title: Why do people always say 'Worth,' in a 1 for 1 trade of kills?
body:
I don't understand this logic of it's always worth for a 1 for 1 trade of kills.

Why? Because if I'm using Fiora and I get a 1 for 1 against Rek'sai then it's going to be more worth for me than for her because I'm going to snowball way harder than a Rek'sai will outside of lane and proceed to dominate the game IF I keep it up consistently which is exactly what happened in a match, even though their jungler ganked 4 times and got 3 assists.

Let me make an even better example: if I'm using Fizz and get a kill against Fiddlesticks, but he kills me as well, guess who's going to snowball harder? Me, because I'm an assassin while Fiddlesticks is not and won't even come close to the potential of snowballing I have.

I just. Do not get why people always say 'Worth,' when a lot of times it isn't worth as you can see from above are examples of where it isn't worth
